s.text: After all, he backed the Kosovo bombing on the grounds that NATO, having started fighting, must win to preserve its credibility.

But beneath the welter of details about Cyprus and Angola, Kissinger makes a surprising claim, arguing that his tough-but-accommodating policy toward the Soviets in the mid-'70s led directly to the confrontational Reagan tactics that won the Cold War in the '80s.
Kissinger seems an unlikely guide for the lost Republicans.
